title: Chicago pharmacist convicted of stealing, selling COVID-19 vaccination cards: DOJ
description: A Chicago area pharmacist was convicted of stealing and selling COVID-19 vaccination cards, the Justice Department announced on Monday.

title: University of Idaho murders: State seeks death penalty against Bryan Kohberger
description: Prosecutors will seek the death penalty against Bryan Kohberger, the suspect in the gruesome University of Idaho murders, according to a new court filing.

title: Ralph Yarl, teen shot after going to the wrong house, speaks out in 'GMA' exclusive
description: Ralph Yarl, teen who was shot after mistakenly going to the wrong house to pick up his siblings, shared his story in an exclusive interview with GMA's Robin Roberts.

title: Secret Service agents testified before Jan. 6 grand jury: Sources
description: Agents from the U.S. Secret Service have testified before the grand jury investigating the events of Jan. 6, a source confirmed to ABC News.

title: 'Vile': With Georgia synagogue protests, antisemitism rears its head in the open
description: Antisemitic incidents across Georgia have prompted criticism from local leaders including Gov. Brian Kemp, Sen. Raphael Warnock, and more.

title: Dolphin moms use baby talk to call to their young, recordings show
description: A new study has found that dolphin mothers also use a kind of high-pitched baby talk with their kids

title: White Florida woman accused in fatal shooting of Black neighbor charged with manslaughter
description: A white woman accused of firing through her door and fatally shooting a Black mother in front of her 9-year-old son in central Florida has been formally charged with manslaughter and assault

title: WATCH:  Lightning strikes tail of aircraft
description: Lightning hit the tail of an aircraft stopped on the tarmac at the Bill and Hillary Clinton National Airport in Little Rock, Arkansas over the weekend.

title: Israel OK's plans for thousands of new settlement homes, defying White House calls for restraint
description: New homes approved in Jewish settlements in the occupied West Bank.

title: Pilot killed when small plane hits North Carolina home, 3 inside unharmed, officials say
description: A single-engine plane crashed into a home near a North Carolina airport.

title: Louisiana could get 2nd majority-Black congressional district after SCOTUS decision
description: The Supreme Court allowed a case on Louisiana's House map,  Ardoin v. Robinson, to move forward which means a 2nd majority-Black district may be drawn

title: WATCH:  97-year-old has cycled over 100,000 miles
description: Clarence Boesenberg of Cedar Rapids, Iowa, will be participating in RAGBRAI, the Register's Annual Great Bicycle Ride Across Iowa.

title: WATCH:  Prince William recounts visit to homeless shelter with mom Princess Diana
description: The Prince of Wales spoke with members of Mosaic Clubhouse mental health service during the launch of his new project to end homelessness.

title: Starbucks union says Pride weekend strikes closed 21 US stores
description: The union organizing Starbucks workers says a strike timed to Pride month closed 21 stores over the weekend, including the company’s flagship Reserve Roastery in Seattle

title: Ukrainian presidential adviser on why Wagner rebellion is 'beginning of the end'
description: Ukrainian presidential adviser Mykhailo Podolyak told ABC News that he believes the chaotic uprising is "the first stage of a huge civil war" in Russia.

title: Biden says US, NATO allies 'not involved' in rebellion in Russia threatening Putin
description: President Biden gave his first public remarks on the short-lived rebellion in Russia, threatening Putin.

title: Supreme Court dismisses case in which Democratic lawmakers sued over Trump hotel lease
description: Case limits lawsuits filed by Congress members against the federal government.

title: Suspected admin of dark web drug site Monopoly Market extradited to US from Austria
description: Austrian authorities say they have extradited the suspected administrator of a vast dark web marketplace for drugs and other illicit goods to the United States

title: Supreme Court won't let a NC charter school force girls to wear skirts to school
description: The Supreme Court has left in place an appellate ruling barring a North Carolina public charter school from requiring girls to wear skirts to school

title: Supreme Court unfreezes Louisiana redistricting case
description: The Supreme Court has lifted its hold on a Louisiana case that could force the state to redraw congressional districts to boost Black voting power

title: WATCH:  Deadly tornado rips through buildings in Indiana
description: At least one person was killed by a deadly storm in Indiana, a county official said.

title: WATCH:  Drone captures pod of whales swimming off Australia
description: A pod of humpback whales was seen swimming off the coast of Australia.

title: The US government is awarding $1.7 billion to buy electric and low-emission buses
description: The U.S. Department of Transportation is awarding $1.7 billion in grants for buying zero- and low-emission buses

title: Ryan Reynolds among new investors backing F1 team Alpine in $218 million deal
description: Formula One team Alpine has secured a $218 million boost from a group of investors that includes Hollywood star Ryan Reynolds

title: Denmark to start the training of Ukrainian pilots on F-16s
description: Denmark’s government says that the training of Ukrainian pilots on F-16 jets has started and the retirement of Scandinavian country’s fleet of aging U.S. fighters has been moved up two years

title: How the Wagner Group's rebellion against Putin unfolded
description: Yevgeny Progozhin, leader of the paramilitary Wagner Group, called Friday for rebellion. His march to Moscow was over by Saturday night.

title: Colorado LGBTQ+ nightclub shooting suspect to be arraigned
description: Colorado Springs shooting suspect who allegedly killed five people at an LGBTQ nightclub called Club Q is set to be arraigned Monday.

title: Hajj pilgrimage starts, with 2 million expected after lifting of COVID measures
description: The Hajj pilgrimage has officially started in Saudi Arabia

title: Myanmar burns $446 million worth of seized drugs
description: The authorities in Myanmar have destroyed more than $446 million worth of illegal drugs seized from around the county to mark an annual international anti-drug trafficking day

title: Early vote count for Guatemala's presidential election gives no indication of leaders
description: All congressional seats and hundreds of local posts are also up for vote.

title: Suspect set to plead guilty in attack that killed 5 in Colorado Springs
description: The suspect in a mass shooting at a Colorado Springs gay nightclub is expected to plead guilty in an attack that killed five people and wounded 17 last year at the longtime sanctuary for the LGBTQ+ community in the mostly conservative city

title: Russia revolt leaves direction of Ukraine war uncertain
description: The rebellious mercenary soldiers who had occupied some Russian cities are gone.

title: Australia’s High Court dismisses Russia’s bid for injunction to stop embassy eviction
description: Australia’s highest court has dismissed Russia’s application for an injunction that would have prevented Moscow's embassy being evicted from a site in the national capital Canberra

title: Flights at Reagan National, Dulles airports resume after being halted by air traffic control woes
description: There was reportedly a problem at a major air traffic control facility.

title: A woman fatally shot an Uber driver who thought she was being kidnapped
description: A Kentucky woman is accused of fatally shooting her West Texas Uber driver after mistakenly believing she was being kidnapped and taken to Mexico
